title: Updated Old English font
content:
Any ideas on this font.

I'm thinking it is a free font, but I can't find it.

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404211454/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_302.png) | 117.96 KB |
author: juano

comments.content: Looks like a modified version of [Bad Manners WW](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404211454/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=mcf_bad_manners_ww&page=1&nb_ppp_old=50&text=spanky+sTokes&nb_ppp=50&psize=l&classt=alphaa). (They are using the "s" and enlarging for the "S" and the "T" for the "t".

Thanks for finding that.

I looked through DaFont and could not find it.

Also explains why there is an inline stroke on the "S" and the"p" but none of the other letters.
